subject: RE: [junit] Re: Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... In fact, Java could even be faster than C++. That s because optimizations at runtime can take into account the exact processor type running on, statistics
messageBody:
Matt wrote:

> I am a 'newbie' to a lot of this discussion group.. but isn't it
> slightly absurd to benchmark Java against C or C++ anyways? It
> sounds like you guys are trying to compare apples to oranges. The
> point of Java isn't that it is fast. I realize that some people want
> to see how MUCH slower than C++ it is.

In fact, Java could even be faster than C++. That's because
optimizations at runtime can take into account the exact processor type
running on, statistics about code usage etc.

Take care, Ilja
